choices.A: Pre-rules can be modified by the local administrator or by a Panorama administrator who has switched to a local firewall.
choices.B: Pre-rules and local device rules can be modified in Panorama.
choices.C: Pre-rules can be viewed on managed firewalls.
choices.D: Pre-rules are modified in Panorama only, and local device rules are modified on local firewalls only.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
B. Panorama is a centralized management tool for Palo Alto Networks firewalls, and it allows administrators to configure and manage both pre-rules and local device rules for managed firewalls.

C. Pre-rules are part of the security policy and can be viewed on managed firewalls. They define policies for traffic before it is matched against security policy rules.

Option A is incorrect because pre-rules are typically managed and modified in Panorama, not on individual firewalls. Panorama administrators can modify pre-rules, but the local administrator on a firewall usually doesn't modify pre-rules directly.

Option D is incorrect because pre-rules can be modified in Panorama, and local device rules can also be modified in Panorama for centralized management. Local device rules are specific to the individual firewall but can still be managed through Panorama.

questions.question_text: Which two statements correctly describe how pre-rules and local device rules are viewed and modified? (Choose two.)

The administrator profile "SYS01 Admin" is configured with authentication profile "Authentication Sequence SYS01," and the authentication sequence SYS01 has a profile list with four authentication profiles:

• Auth Profile LDAP
• Auth Profile Radius
• Auth Profile Local
• Auth Profile TACACS

After a network outage, the LDAP server is no longer reachable. The RADIUS server is still reachable but has lost the "SYS01 Admin" username and password.

What is the "SYS01 Admin" login capability after the outage?

choices.A: Auth KO because RADIUS server lost user and password for SYS01 Admin
choices.C: Auth OK because of the Auth Profile Local
choices.B: Auth OK because of the Auth Profile TACACS
choices.D: Auth KO because LDAP server is not reachable

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Auth OK because of the Auth Profile Local

questions.question_text: Which three types of Source NAT are available to users inside a NGFW? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BCE
Per the FW.... Policies >> NAT >> Add >> Translated Packet >> Source Address Translation >> Translation Type >> Drop down

Options are Dynamic IP and Port, Dynamic IP and Static IP

questions.question_text:
The CFO found a USB drive in the parking lot and decide to plug it into their corporate laptop. The USB drive had malware on it that loaded onto their computer and then contacted a known command and control (CnC) server, which ordered the infected machine to begin Exfiltrating data from the laptop.
Which security profile feature could have been used to prevent the communication with the CnC server?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct
Yes, the correct answer is A. DNS Sinkhole is not a Category of URL Filtering.
DNS sinkhole can only be configured on the antispyware security profile. Answer is A.

comments.content:
Answer C is saying block DNS Sinkhole which is incorrect
The answer is A

discussion.content: Because they mention 'known C2 server' I think that URL filtering & DNS sinkhole is also a legitimate answer here. Known URLs that are associated with C2 are blocked via Pan-DB

choices.D: Create a security policy and enable DNS Sinkhole
choices.B: Create an antivirus profile and enable DNS Sinkhole
choices.A: Create an anti-spyware profile and enable DNS Sinkhole
choices.C: Create a URL filtering profile and block the DNS Sinkhole category

questions.question_text: What are the two main reasons a custom application is created? (Choose two.)

choices.C: To correctly identify an internal application in the traffic log
choices.A: To change the default categorization of an application
choices.D: To reduce unidentified traffic on a network

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
answers are correct

reference: https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/pan-os/11-0/pan-os-admin/app-id/use-application-objects-in-policy/create-a-custom-application
